trans-unit.source: Apache Storm tutorial: Get started with Storm | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Apache Storm tutorial: Get started with Storm | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Get started with big data analytics using Apache Storm and the Storm Starter samples on HDInsight. Learn how to use Storm to process data real-time.
trans-unit.target: Get started with big data analytics using Apache Storm and the Storm Starter samples on HDInsight. Learn how to use Storm to process data real-time.

trans-unit.source: Apache Storm is a scalable, fault-tolerant, distributed, real-time computation system for processing streams of data.
trans-unit.target: Apache Storm is a scalable, fault-tolerant, distributed, real-time computation system for processing streams of data.

trans-unit.source: With Storm on Azure HDInsight, you can create a cloud-based Storm cluster that performs big data analytics in real time.
trans-unit.target: With Storm on Azure HDInsight, you can create a cloud-based Storm cluster that performs big data analytics in real time.

trans-unit.source: You must have the following to successfully complete this Apache Storm tutorial:
trans-unit.target: You must have the following to successfully complete this Apache Storm tutorial:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Storm on HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage for storing log files and topologies submitted to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Storm on HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage for storing log files and topologies submitted to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to create an Azure Storage account for use with your cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to create an Azure Storage account for use with your cluster:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal[preview-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal[preview-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Select NEW, select Data Analytics, and then select HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Select NEW, select Data Analytics, and then select HDInsight

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Creating a new cluster in the Azure Preview Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Creating a new cluster in the Azure Preview Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a Cluster Name, then select Storm for the Cluster Type.
trans-unit.target: Enter a Cluster Name, then select Storm for the Cluster Type.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear beside the Cluster Name if it is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear beside the Cluster Name if it is available.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cluster name, cluster type, and OS Type</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cluster name, cluster type, and OS Type</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have more than one subscription, select the Subscription entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than one subscription, select the Subscription entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For Resource Group, you can select the entry to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.
trans-unit.target: For Resource Group, you can select the entry to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.

trans-unit.source: Or you can select Create New and then enter the name of the new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Or you can select Create New and then enter the name of the new resource group.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear to indicate if the new group name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear to indicate if the new group name is available.

trans-unit.source: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.
trans-unit.target: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.

trans-unit.source: Select Credentials, then enter a Cluster Login Username and Cluster Login Password.
trans-unit.target: Select Credentials, then enter a Cluster Login Username and Cluster Login Password.

trans-unit.source: Finally, use the Select button to set the credentials.
trans-unit.target: Finally, use the Select button to set the credentials.

trans-unit.source: Remote desktop will not be used in this document, so you can leave it disabled.
trans-unit.target: Remote desktop will not be used in this document, so you can leave it disabled.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cluster credentials blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cluster credentials blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For Data Source, you can select the entry to choose an existing data source, or create a new one.
trans-unit.target: For Data Source, you can select the entry to choose an existing data source, or create a new one.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Data source blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Data source blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Currently you can select an Azure Storage Account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Currently you can select an Azure Storage Account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to understand the entries on the Data Source blade.
trans-unit.target: Use the following to understand the entries on the Data Source blade.

trans-unit.source: Selection Method: Set this to From all subscriptions to enable browsing of storage accounts on your subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Selection Method: Set this to From all subscriptions to enable browsing of storage accounts on your subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Set to Access Key if you want to enter the Storage Name and Access Key of an existing storage account.
trans-unit.target: Set to Access Key if you want to enter the Storage Name and Access Key of an existing storage account.

trans-unit.source: Create New: Use this to create a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: Create New: Use this to create a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear if the name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear if the name is available.

trans-unit.source: Choose Default Container: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Choose Default Container: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.
trans-unit.target: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.

trans-unit.source: Location: The geographic region that the storage account will be is in, or will be created in.
trans-unit.target: Location: The geographic region that the storage account will be is in, or will be created in.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the location for the default data source will also set the location of the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Selecting the location for the default data source will also set the location of the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.
trans-unit.target: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.

trans-unit.source: Select: Use this to save the data source configuration.
trans-unit.target: Select: Use this to save the data source configuration.

trans-unit.source: Select Node Pricing Tiers to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: Select Node Pricing Tiers to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: By default, the number of worker nodes will be set to 4.
trans-unit.target: By default, the number of worker nodes will be set to 4.

trans-unit.source: Set this to 1, as this will be sufficient for this tutorial and will reduce the cost of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Set this to 1, as this will be sufficient for this tutorial and will reduce the cost of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown at the bottom of this blade.
trans-unit.target: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown at the bottom of this blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Node pricing tiers blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Node pricing tiers blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Use the Select button to save the Node Pricing Tiers information.
trans-unit.target: Use the Select button to save the Node Pricing Tiers information.

trans-unit.source: Select Optional Configuration.
trans-unit.target: Select Optional Configuration.

trans-unit.source: This blade allows you to select the cluster version, as well as configure other optional settings such as joining a Virtual Network or setting up an External Metastore to hold data for Hive and Oozie.
trans-unit.target: This blade allows you to select the cluster version, as well as configure other optional settings such as joining a Virtual Network or setting up an External Metastore to hold data for Hive and Oozie.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Optional configuration blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Optional configuration blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Ensure that Pin to Startboard is selected, and then select Create.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that Pin to Startboard is selected, and then select Create.

trans-unit.source: This will create the cluster and add a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: This will create the cluster and add a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.
trans-unit.target: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.

trans-unit.source: | While provisioning | Provisioning complete | | ------------------ | --------------------- | | <linkText>Provisioning indicator on startboard</linkText> | <linkText>Provisioned cluster tile</linkText> |
trans-unit.target: | While provisioning | Provisioning complete | | ------------------ | --------------------- | | <linkText>Provisioning indicator on startboard</linkText> | <linkText>Provisioned cluster tile</linkText> |

trans-unit.source: It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the Notifications entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the Notifications entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: This Apache Storm tutorial introduces you to big data analytics using the Storm Starter samples on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: This Apache Storm tutorial introduces you to big data analytics using the Storm Starter samples on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Each Storm on HDInsight cluster comes with the Storm Dashboard, which can be used to upload and run Storm topologies on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Each Storm on HDInsight cluster comes with the Storm Dashboard, which can be used to upload and run Storm topologies on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Each cluster also comes with sample topologies that can be run directly from the Storm Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Each cluster also comes with sample topologies that can be run directly from the Storm Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: The dashboard is located at https://<clustername>.azurehdinsight.net//, where clustername is the name of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The dashboard is located at https://<clustername>.azurehdinsight.net//, where clustername is the name of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can also find a link to the dashboard by selecting the cluster from the Startboard and selecting the Dashboard link at the top of the blade.
trans-unit.target: You can also find a link to the dashboard by selecting the cluster from the Startboard and selecting the Dashboard link at the top of the blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure portal with Storm Dashboard link</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure portal with Storm Dashboard link</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When connecting to the dashboard, you will be prompted to enter a user name and password.
trans-unit.target: When connecting to the dashboard, you will be prompted to enter a user name and password.

trans-unit.source: This is the administrator name (admin) and password used when you created the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This is the administrator name (admin) and password used when you created the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Once the Storm Dashboard has loaded, you will see the Submit Topology form.
trans-unit.target: Once the Storm Dashboard has loaded, you will see the Submit Topology form.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Submit your Storm Starter topology with the Storm Dashboard.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Submit your Storm Starter topology with the Storm Dashboard.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Submit Topology form can be used to upload and run .jar files containing Storm topologies.
trans-unit.target: The Submit Topology form can be used to upload and run .jar files containing Storm topologies.

trans-unit.source: It also includes several basic samples that are provided with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: It also includes several basic samples that are provided with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The samples provided with the cluster include several variations of a word-counting topology.
trans-unit.target: The samples provided with the cluster include several variations of a word-counting topology.

trans-unit.source: These samples include a spout that randomly emits sentences, and bolts that break each sentence into individual words, then count how many times each word has occurred.
trans-unit.target: These samples include a spout that randomly emits sentences, and bolts that break each sentence into individual words, then count how many times each word has occurred.

trans-unit.source: These samples are from the <linkText>Storm Starter samples</linkText><title></title>, which are a part of Apache Storm.
trans-unit.target: These samples are from the <linkText>Storm Starter samples</linkText><title></title>, which are a part of Apache Storm.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to run a Storm Starter sample:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to run a Storm Starter sample:

trans-unit.source: Select StormStarter - WordCount from the Jar File drop-down.
trans-unit.target: Select StormStarter - WordCount from the Jar File drop-down.

trans-unit.source: This should populate the Class Name and Additional Parameters fields with the parameters for this sample.
trans-unit.target: This should populate the Class Name and Additional Parameters fields with the parameters for this sample.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Storm Starter WordCount selected on Storm Dashboard.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Storm Starter WordCount selected on Storm Dashboard.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Class Name - The class in the .jar file that submits the topology.
trans-unit.target: Class Name - The class in the .jar file that submits the topology.

trans-unit.source: Additional Parameters - Any parameters required by the topology.
trans-unit.target: Additional Parameters - Any parameters required by the topology.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the field is used to provide a friendly name for the submitted topology.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the field is used to provide a friendly name for the submitted topology.

trans-unit.source: Click the Submit button.
trans-unit.target: Click the Submit button.

trans-unit.source: After a moment, the Result field will display the command used to submit the job, as well as the results of the command.
trans-unit.target: After a moment, the Result field will display the command used to submit the job, as well as the results of the command.

trans-unit.source: The Error field will display any errors that occur in submitting the topology.
trans-unit.target: The Error field will display any errors that occur in submitting the topology.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Submit button and results of Storm Starter WordCount.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Submit button and results of Storm Starter WordCount.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The results do not indicate that the topology has finished - a Storm topology, once started, runs until you stop it. The word-count topology will generate random sentences, and keep a count of how many times it encounters each word, until you stop it.
trans-unit.target: The results do not indicate that the topology has finished - a Storm topology, once started, runs until you stop it. The word-count topology will generate random sentences, and keep a count of how many times it encounters each word, until you stop it.

trans-unit.source: The Storm UI can be used to monitor the topology.
trans-unit.target: The Storm UI can be used to monitor the topology.

trans-unit.source: Select Storm UI from the top of the Storm Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Select Storm UI from the top of the Storm Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: This will display summary information for the cluster and all running topologies.
trans-unit.target: This will display summary information for the cluster and all running topologies.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Storm dashboard showing the Storm Starter WordCount topology summary.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Storm dashboard showing the Storm Starter WordCount topology summary.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the page above, you can see the time the topology has been active, as well as the number of workers, executors, and tasks being used.
trans-unit.target: From the page above, you can see the time the topology has been active, as well as the number of workers, executors, and tasks being used.

trans-unit.source: The Name column contains the friendly name supplied earlier via the Additional Parameters field.
trans-unit.target: The Name column contains the friendly name supplied earlier via the Additional Parameters field.

trans-unit.source: Under Topology summary, select the wordcount entry in the Name column.
trans-unit.target: Under Topology summary, select the wordcount entry in the Name column.

trans-unit.source: This will display more information about the topology.
trans-unit.target: This will display more information about the topology.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Storm Dashboard with Storm Starter WordCount topology information.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Storm Dashboard with Storm Starter WordCount topology information.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This page provides the following information:
trans-unit.target: This page provides the following information:

trans-unit.source: Topology stats - Basic information on the topology performance, organized into time windows.
trans-unit.target: Topology stats - Basic information on the topology performance, organized into time windows.

trans-unit.source: Selecting a specific time window changes the time window for information displayed in other sections of the page.
trans-unit.target: Selecting a specific time window changes the time window for information displayed in other sections of the page.

trans-unit.source: Spouts - Basic information about spouts, including the last error returned by each spout.
trans-unit.target: Spouts - Basic information about spouts, including the last error returned by each spout.

trans-unit.source: Bolts - Basic information about bolts.
trans-unit.target: Bolts - Basic information about bolts.

trans-unit.source: Topology configuration - Detailed information about the topology configuration.
trans-unit.target: Topology configuration - Detailed information about the topology configuration.

trans-unit.source: This page also provides actions that can be taken on the topology:
trans-unit.target: This page also provides actions that can be taken on the topology:

trans-unit.source: Activate - Resumes processing of a deactivated topology.
trans-unit.target: Activate - Resumes processing of a deactivated topology.

trans-unit.source: Deactivate - Pauses a running topology.
trans-unit.target: Deactivate - Pauses a running topology.

trans-unit.source: Rebalance - Adjusts the parallelism of the topology.
trans-unit.target: Rebalance - Adjusts the parallelism of the topology.

trans-unit.source: You should rebalance running topologies after you have changed the number of nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You should rebalance running topologies after you have changed the number of nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: This allows the topology to adjust parallelism to compensate for the increased/decreased number of nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This allows the topology to adjust parallelism to compensate for the increased/decreased number of nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Understanding the parallelism of a Storm topology</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Understanding the parallelism of a Storm topology</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Kill - Terminates a Storm topology after the specified timeout.
trans-unit.target: Kill - Terminates a Storm topology after the specified timeout.

trans-unit.source: From this page, select an entry from the Spouts or Bolts section.
trans-unit.target: From this page, select an entry from the Spouts or Bolts section.

trans-unit.source: This will display information about the selected component.
trans-unit.target: This will display information about the selected component.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Storm Dachborad with information about selected components.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Storm Dachborad with information about selected components.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This page displays the following information:
trans-unit.target: This page displays the following information:

trans-unit.source: Spout/Bolt stats - Basic information on the component performance, organized into time windows.
trans-unit.target: Spout/Bolt stats - Basic information on the component performance, organized into time windows.

trans-unit.source: Selecting a specific time window changes the time window for information displayed in other sections of the page.
trans-unit.target: Selecting a specific time window changes the time window for information displayed in other sections of the page.

trans-unit.source: Input stats (bolt only) - Information on components that produce data consumed by the bolt.
trans-unit.target: Input stats (bolt only) - Information on components that produce data consumed by the bolt.

trans-unit.source: Output stats - Information on data emitted by this bolt.
trans-unit.target: Output stats - Information on data emitted by this bolt.

trans-unit.source: Executors - Information on instances of this component.
trans-unit.target: Executors - Information on instances of this component.

trans-unit.source: Errors - Errors produced by this component.
trans-unit.target: Errors - Errors produced by this component.

trans-unit.source: When viewing the details of a spout or bolt, select an entry from the Port column in the Executors section to view details for a specific instance of the component.
trans-unit.target: When viewing the details of a spout or bolt, select an entry from the Port column in the Executors section to view details for a specific instance of the component.

trans-unit.source: From this data you can see that the word seven has occurred 1493957 times.
trans-unit.target: From this data you can see that the word seven has occurred 1493957 times.

trans-unit.source: That is how many times it has been encountered since this topology was started.
trans-unit.target: That is how many times it has been encountered since this topology was started.

trans-unit.source: Return to the Topology summary page for the word-count topology, and then select the Kill button from the Topology actions section.
trans-unit.target: Return to the Topology summary page for the word-count topology, and then select the Kill button from the Topology actions section.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter 10 for the seconds to wait before stopping the topology.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter 10 for the seconds to wait before stopping the topology.

trans-unit.source: After the timeout period, the topology will no longer appear when you visit the Storm UI section of the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: After the timeout period, the topology will no longer appear when you visit the Storm UI section of the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: In this Apache Storm tutorial, you used the Storm Starter to learn how to create a Storm on HDInsight cluster and use the Storm Dashboard to deploy, monitor, and manage Storm topologies.
trans-unit.target: In this Apache Storm tutorial, you used the Storm Starter to learn how to create a Storm on HDInsight cluster and use the Storm Dashboard to deploy, monitor, and manage Storm topologies.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio - HDInsight Tools allows you to use Visual Studio to submit, monitor, and manage Storm topologies similar to the Storm Dashboard mentioned earlier.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio - HDInsight Tools allows you to use Visual Studio to submit, monitor, and manage Storm topologies similar to the Storm Dashboard mentioned earlier.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Tools also provides the ability to create C# Storm topologies, and includes sample topologies that you can deploy and run on your cluster.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Tools also provides the ability to create C# Storm topologies, and includes sample topologies that you can deploy and run on your cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Get Started using the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Get Started using the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Sample files - The HDInsight Storm cluster provides several examples in the %STORM_HOME%\contrib directory.
trans-unit.target: Sample files - The HDInsight Storm cluster provides several examples in the %STORM_HOME%\contrib directory.

trans-unit.source: Each example should contain the following:
trans-unit.target: Each example should contain the following:

trans-unit.source: The source code - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-sources.jar
trans-unit.target: The source code - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-sources.jar

trans-unit.source: The Java docs - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-javadoc.jar
trans-unit.target: The Java docs - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-javadoc.jar

trans-unit.source: The example - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-jar-with-dependencies.jar
trans-unit.target: The example - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-jar-with-dependencies.jar

trans-unit.source: Use the 'jar' command to extract the source code or Java docs.
trans-unit.target: Use the 'jar' command to extract the source code or Java docs.

trans-unit.source: For example, 'jar -xvf storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0.2057-javadoc.jar'.
trans-unit.target: For example, 'jar -xvf storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0.2057-javadoc.jar'.

trans-unit.source: Java docs consist of webpages.
trans-unit.target: Java docs consist of webpages.

trans-unit.source: Once extracted, use a browser to view the index.html file.
trans-unit.target: Once extracted, use a browser to view the index.html file.

trans-unit.source: To access these samples, you must enable Remote Desktop for the Storm on HDInsight cluster, and then copy the files from %STORM_HOME%\contrib.
trans-unit.target: To access these samples, you must enable Remote Desktop for the Storm on HDInsight cluster, and then copy the files from %STORM_HOME%\contrib.

trans-unit.source: The following document contains a list of other examples that can be used with Storm on HDInsight:
trans-unit.target: The following document contains a list of other examples that can be used with Storm on HDInsight:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Example topologies for Storm on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Example topologies for Storm on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: https://storm.incubator.apache.org
trans-unit.target: https://storm.incubator.apache.org

trans-unit.source: http://storm.incubator.apache.org/documentation/Documentation.html
trans-unit.target: http://storm.incubator.apache.org/documentation/Documentation.html

trans-unit.source: https://github.com/apache/storm/tree/master/examples/storm-starter
trans-unit.target: https://github.com/apache/storm/tree/master/examples/storm-starter

trans-unit.source: https://storm.incubator.apache.org/apidocs/
trans-unit.target: https://storm.incubator.apache.org/apidocs/

trans-unit.source: https://manage.windowsazure.com/
trans-unit.target: https://manage.windowsazure.com/

trans-unit.source: hdinsight-provision-clusters.md
trans-unit.target: hdinsight-provision-clusters.md

trans-unit.source: https://portal.azure.com/
trans-unit.target: https://portal.azure.com/
